umd.cs.shop2
Class Javalisp

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--umd.cs.shop2.Javalisp
class Javalisp
extends java.lang.Object

Extremely simple but vauguely general-purpose mechanism for interacting with Lisp in Java using Javatcl. Assumes that the Tcl library used includes the Expect extension.

Field Summary
(package private)  Javatcl jt
          The Tcl environment used to connect to the Common Lisp interpretter.
static java.lang.String LISP
          Command to invoke the Common Lisp interpretter

          The string retval is used to keep the return value from the assorted evalTcl calls.

Field Detail

LISP

public static final java.lang.String LISP
Command to invoke the Common Lisp interpretter

See Also:
Constant Field Values

jt

Javatcl jt
The Tcl environment used to connect to the Common Lisp interpretter.

retval

java.lang.String retval
The string retval is used to keep the return value from the assorted evalTcl calls. Often this is ignored in the current code. In general though, it should be checked for errors, which are generally indicated using the return value "TCL_ERROR".

Constructor Detail

Javalisp

public Javalisp(boolean viewLisp)
Parameters:
viewLisp - If true, all text sent to and received from Lisp will be displayed on the standard output.

Executes a Lisp command

Parameters:
lispCmd - The command
Returns:
The string representation of the value returned from the Lisp command

endLisp

public void endLisp()
Terminates the Lisp interpretter and exists the Tcl session
